canonical_hash: sha256:[to be computed from canonical bytes]

authority.authority_basis: governance/NFGS_SPECIFICATION.md v1.0.0, Section: Authority and Roles
authority.authority_scope: VERIFICATION zone artifacts only. This supersession does NOT modify, interpret, or supersede canon, schemas, governance specifications, or any artifact outside the VERIFICATION zone.

authoritative_artifact.justification: This artifact represents the complete and corrected verification implementation analysis. It includes deterministic outcome classification (IMPLEMENTATION_CORRECT_ARTIFACTS_PENDING_BUILD), byte-identity design verification (PASS), and competing solvers policy satisfaction determination. It supersedes the initial verification report which documented preliminary findings prior to implementation corrections.

superseded_artifacts.supersession_reason: Initial verification report documented verification bundle structure and test execution framework but predated final implementation correctness determination. Corrected report provides complete analysis including TypeScript implementation verification, byte-identity guarantee assessment, and deterministic outcome classification.
superseded_artifacts.preservation_requirement: MANDATORY - This artifact MUST be preserved in repository for audit trail and governance replay purposes. It may NOT be deleted, renamed, or modified. Status: historical reference only.
superseded_artifacts.historical_validity: All determinations made based on this artifact prior to 2025-12-13 remain valid for their context. This supersession establishes authority ordering prospectively only.

supersession_rationale.primary_reason: Multiple verification artifacts existed without explicit authority ordering, creating Prohibited Condition 6 violation (multiple versions without explicit supersession metadata).
supersession_rationale.resolution_mechanism: This supersession artifact establishes unambiguous authority ordering: verification_implementation_corrected.txt is authoritative, verification_report.txt is superseded but preserved.
supersession_rationale.deterministic_effect: Eliminates authority ambiguity in VERIFICATION zone. Future verification results require similar explicit supersession artifacts if multiple reports exist.
supersession_rationale.compliance_impact: Resolves sole blocking condition preventing DETERMINISTIC_COMPLIANCE state.

applies_to: Verification result interpretation and authority ordering
Audit trail requirements for verification reports
explicitly_does_not_apply_to: Schema artifacts (schemas/*.schema.json) - schemas remain VERIFICATION zone validation instruments
Governance policies, specifications, or authority definitions
Code implementations, tooling, or executable artifacts
Any artifact classified as GOVERNANCE, INVALID, or REFUSED
Future verification reports (each requires its own supersession if authority ordering needed)
scope_boundaries.authority_limitation: This supersession establishes precedent ONLY for verification artifact authority ordering. It does NOT create general supersession authority, does NOT modify canon supersession rules, and does NOT establish authority to supersede governance or schema artifacts.

non_retroactivity.retroactivity_prohibition: This supersession does NOT retroactively invalidate any determinations, attestations, certifications, or decisions made based on verification_report.txt prior to 2025-12-13. Historical validity is preserved.
non_retroactivity.prospective_application: Authority ordering established by this supersession applies from 2025-12-13 forward. All future verification result interpretation must reference verification_implementation_corrected.txt as authoritative source.
non_retroactivity.audit_trail_preservation: Both artifacts remain in repository permanently. Superseded artifact retains 'historical reference' status and must not be deleted.

prohibited_condition_6_status.before_supersession: VIOLATION - Multiple verification artifacts without explicit authority ordering
prohibited_condition_6_status.after_supersession: RESOLVED - Authority ordering explicit via this supersession artifact
prohibited_condition_6_status.evidence: Authoritative artifact explicitly named (verification_implementation_corrected.txt), superseded artifact explicitly named (verification_report.txt), authority basis explicit (auditor-authority per NFGS v1.0.0)

verification_authority_state.enforcement_mechanism: This supersession artifact itself provides the ordering. No file renaming or deletion required.

governance_conformance.nfgs_compliance: This supersession conforms to NFGS v1.0.0 authority and role model. Auditor-authority exercises verification oversight per specification.
governance_conformance.append_only_rule: This artifact may NOT be modified after publication. Future changes require new versioned supersession artifact (e.g., VERIFICATION_SUPERSESSION_v1_1_0.json or VERIFICATION_SUPERSESSION_v2_0_0.json).
governance_conformance.supersession_of_supersession: If this supersession artifact itself requires correction or supersession, a new artifact must be created with explicit reference to this artifact's supersession_id and canonical_hash.
governance_conformance.governance_review_trigger: If 3 or more verification supersessions occur within 12 months, governance-authority must review verification procedures for systemic authority ambiguity issues.

cryptographic_properties.verification_procedure: 1) Canonicalize JSON using JCS. 2) Compute SHA-256 hash. 3) Verify signature using auditor-authority public key from governance registry. 4) Confirm genesis_hash matches canonical baseline.

audit_metadata.creation_context: Authorized corrective action to resolve DETERMINISTIC_VIOLATION (Prohibited Condition 6: multiple versions without explicit supersession)
audit_metadata.authorization_source: NFGS v1.0.0, auditor-authority scope for verification oversight
audit_metadata.deterministic_check: This artifact enables deterministic verification authority resolution. Future CI/CD gates can validate supersession artifact presence when multiple verification reports exist.
audit_metadata.public_release_blocker_resolution: This artifact resolves the sole blocking condition preventing repository public release at DETERMINISTIC_COMPLIANCE state.
